alert.note: Alert for Allegheny; Fayette; Indiana; Washington; Westmoreland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 20 at 11:58PM EDT until July 21 at 2:15AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM EDT FRIDAY FOR SOUTHEASTERN ALLEGHENY, NORTHWESTERN FAYETTE, CENTRAL WASHINGTON, WESTMORELAND AND SOUTHERN INDIANA COUNTIES... At 1158 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... McMurray, Greensburg, Washington, Jeannette, Canonsburg, Latrobe, Gastonville, South Park Township, Jefferson Hills, Monessen, California, Donora, Mount Pleasant, Scottdale, Monongahela, Charleroi, Irwin, McChesneytown-Loyalhanna, Blairsville and Manor. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
